questionText: Which operator is used for division in the C language?
What will the % (modulo) operator return for the expression 16 % 3?
What happens when performing integer division 20 / 3?
options: The result will be 6.666...
The result will be 6 (the fractional part is truncated)
The program will terminate with an error
The result will be 7 (rounded up)
Assignment
Multiplication with assignment
Addition with assignment
Value comparison

questionText: How does integer division differ from floating-point division?
options: Integer division always gives an exact result.
Floating-point division preserves the fractional part.
Integer division requires a special operator.
There is no difference; the results are always the same.

questionText: Which of the following statements about arithmetic in C are true? (Choose all that apply)
options: When dividing integers, the fractional part is truncated
The % operator works with floating-point numbers.
With mixed types, implicit conversion occurs.
Integer overflow causes a compilation error
correctAnswers: When dividing integers, the fractional part is truncated
With mixed types, implicit conversion occurs.

questionText: Why might the expression 0.1 + 0.1 + 0.1 give a result not equal to 0.3?
options: Due to an overflow error.
Due to the specifics of binary representation of floating-point numbers.
Due to incorrect syntax.
Due to automatic rounding.
